title: Legal eagles flock to Melbourne CBD's west
text:
If a change is as good as a holiday, then lawyers from a swath of Melbourne's top-tier firms should look forward to feeling refreshed in the new year when their offices up stumps.

Seven of Melbourne's largest commercial law firms are expected to move to new offices in 2020, with most of them flocking to the city's western precinct.

Next year four commercial law firms will move into Collins Arch – also known as "the pantscraper" for its unusual shape.

King & Wood Mallesons, MinterEllison, HWL Ebsworth Lawyers and Gadens will set up shop in Cbus Property's Collins Arch development at 433-439 Collins Street.

Norton Rose Fulbright will move into Mirvac's Olderfleet development at 477 Collins Street next year.

DLA Piper and Ashurst will move to Dexus' development at 80 Collins Street in the CBD's east.
description: As supply in the Docklands precinct dwindles, tenants have turned their attention to Melbourne's western core.
